p: After the isolation and identification of P. stutzeri, the biomass was obtained according to the method described by Juan and Tsai [ 29]. For this, the pure culture of P. stutzeri was cultured in Nutrient Broth (Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA) for 60 h at 150 rpm and 35 Â°C, until it reached the stationary state. Then, the biomass was filtered and stored under asepsis.
